Description: Limestone ostracon: on the recto, partly faded and incomplete, seven lines of a text containing a prayer to Amun. On the verso, a partly damaged drawing of a goddess, possibly Sefekhibu, standing on a pedestal placed within a summarily sketched pavilion.
Curator's comments: Orthography and handwriting of the text on the recto similar to e.g. O. Cairo 25214+Vienna 6155; cf. G. Vittmann, ‘Wiener Zeitschrift für die Kunde des Morgenlandes’ 72 (1980), pp. 1-6 and pls. I—III.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393034) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393034)
